RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Ps-doutor em Histria do Direito Constitucional pela Universidad de Salamanca (Espanha); Doutor em Histria do Direito Constitucional pela Universidad de Salamanca; European Master`s Degree (Mestre) pela Universit Degli Studio di Milano e Universit Degli Studio di Messina (Italia), Facolt di Scienze Politiche, Dipartimento di Storia e Comparazione degli Ordinamenti Giuridiche e Politiche; Mestre pela Universidad Internacional de Andalucia e Universidad de Huelva (Espanha) em Estudos Jurdicos Avanados e Proteo do Meio Ambiente; Ps-graduado em Direitos Humanos pela Universidad de Salamanca (Espanha); Licenciado em Histria pela Universidade Federal da Bahia (UFBA); Bacharel em Direito pela Universidade Catlica do Salvador (UCSAL). A linha de investigao est fixada no sculo XIX. Est vinculado ao departamento de Direito Pblico Geral da Faculdade de Direito da Universidade de Salamanca como Professor Convidado. membro do Grupo Oficial de Investigao sobre as Independncias da Universidad de Salamanca - INDUSAL, que est vinculado ao departamento de Histria das Amricas - Faculdad de Geografa y Historia - INDUSAL. Foi Investigador Visitante da Faculdade de Direito da Universidade de Coimbra. Recebeu o PREMIO EXTRAORDINARIO da Universidad de Salamanca, por melhor tese defendida no Ano Acadmico 2013/2014. Advogado Inscrito na OAB/Brasil. Membro avaliador da revista Cadernos do Programa de Ps-Graduao em Direito PPGDir/UFRGS, Membro avaliador da Revista da Faculdade de Direito da UFRGS. Membro avaliador da Revista do Instituto Histrico e Geogrfico do Rio Grande do Sul. Membro Avaliador da Revista Eletrnica da Faculdade de Direito de Pelotas/RS. Autor de vrios livros que abordam a Histria do Direito Ibero-brasileira.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Post-doctorate in History of Constitutional Law at the Universidad de Salamanca (Spain); Doctor of History of Constitutional Law at the University of Salamanca; European Master`s Degree (Master) by the Universit Degli Studio di Milano and Universit Degli Studio di Messina (Italy), Facolt di Scienze Politiche, Dipartimento di Storia and Comparazione degli Ordinamenti Giuridiche and Politiche; Master by the International University of Andalusia and University of Huelva (Spain) in Juridicos Advanced Studies and protection of the environment; Postgraduate degree in Human Rights from the University of Salamanca (Spain); Degree in History from the Federal University of Bahia (UFBA); Bachelor of Law from the Catholic University of Salvador (UCSAL). The research line is laid in the nineteenth century. It is linked to the General Public Law department of the Law School of the University of Salamanca as Visiting Professor. Official Member of the Research Group on the Independence of the Universidad de Salamanca - INDUSAL, which is linked to the history department of the Americas - Facultad de Geografa y Historia - INDUSAL. He was Visiting Researcher at the Faculty of Law, University of Coimbra. He received the PRIZE EXTRAORDINARIO the Universidad de Salamanca, for best thesis defended in the academic year 2013/2014. Lawyer Admitted to OAB / Brazil. PHD IN RIGHT - &quot;revalidated&quot; by the Federal University of Pernambuco (UFPE) at the Law School through the Research Councils and Graduate.&#10;Evaluation member of the journal Cadernos do Programa de Ps-Graduao em Direito PPGDir / UFRGS, Evaluation member of the Journal of the Faculty of Law of UFRGS. Member evaluating the Journal of the Historical and Geographical Institute of Rio Grande do Sul.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Citizenship in the Constitution of the Empire of Brazil sought the French revolutionary logic of bipartition of citizenship into assets and liabilities. Meanwhile, the establishment of a denominational state brought constitutional mechanisms of exclusion to those who did not profess the Catholic religion; while also allowing a certain freedom of religion in the same text. This degree of openness, which touches upon the religious element, brought in the possibility for the discussion, during the nineteenth century, of the inclusion of &quot;non-Catholics&quot; among the active citizens of the Empire.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Procesos Constitucionales en Iberoamerica: las exclusiones en Cdiz (1812), Portugal (1822) y Brasil (1824)
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Procesos Constitucionales en Iberoamerica: las exclusiones en Cdiz (1812), Portugal (1822) y Brasil (1824)

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: El flujo y reflujo revolucionario en la prensa espaola del trienio liberal: Npoles, Oporto y Turn
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: The Revolutionary Ebb and Flow in the Spanish Press of the Liberal Triennium: Naples, Porto and Turin

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Los procesos revolucionarios en Npoles, Oporto y Turn estuvieron&#10;directamente influidos por los sucesos de la Espaa de 1820. El pronunciamiento de&#10;Riego result en la adopcin de la Constitucin de Cdiz y en el establecimiento de un&#10;rgimen liberal que perdur hasta 1823. En este Trienio Liberal los peridicos espaoles&#10;cubrieron ampliamente las revoluciones liberales en los reinos de Cerdea y de las&#10;Dos Sicilias, adems de Portugal. El texto doceaista tuvo una gran repercusin a la&#10;poca, siendo comentado tanto en Francia como en Inglaterra, de una forma terica,&#10;y adoptado en la prctica por aqullos reinos antes mencionados. De forma que las&#10;noticias de estos eventos y el consecuente xito de la Constitucin de 1812 en aquellos&#10;procesos revolucionarios, tuvo una amplia cobertura periodstica. Abstrayendo de ah, un&#10;movimiento de flujo ideolgico para fuera de las fronteras espaolas y reflujo de estas&#10;mismas ideologas en los papeles pblicos de la Espaa del Trienio Liberal.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The revolutionary processes in Naples, Porto and Turin were directly influenced&#10;by the Spanish events of 1820. Riegos military uprising resulted in the adoption of the&#10;Constitution of Cdiz and in the establishment of a liberal regime that would last until&#10;1823. During this Liberal Triennium Spanish newspapers would provide ample coverage&#10;of the liberal revolutions in the kingdoms of Sardinia, the two Sicilies and in Portugal.&#10;The Constitution of Cdiz would have great impact on the era, being theoretically&#10;analyzed and remarked upon in France as well as in England and was adopted by the&#10;aforementioned mentioned kingdoms. The news of these events and the consequent&#10;success of the Constitution of 1812 in those revolutionary processes, received wide press&#10;coverage. That press coverage created an ideological flow outside Spanish borders and&#10;an ebb of these same ideologies found in Spanish public documents during the Liberal&#10;Triennium.
